result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Sexton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J. Sexton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J. Sexton was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay $2000 in counseling costs for the victim out of cash bond posted; monies shall be transferred to the DA Trust Account and DA's office shall disburse said funds

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Sexton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Summary

Defendant Robert J. Sexton in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court believes they may have a conflict in this case, court excuses itself for the parties to talk.  No request for recusal. State briefs the court on the amended charges.  Court reviews amended charges and penalties, def pleads no contest to ct. 2, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, ct 1 is dismissed outright. State heard, defense counsel heard, defendant heard, court heard and sentence imposed.  Court heard and sentence imposed. 

ct. 2
court costs to be paid with bond money
$2000 in counseling costs for the child victim, bond money to be transferred to the DA Trust account, DA's office will disburse the funds.

Defendant Robert J. Sexton in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing filed by defense to modify conditions of bond.  Atty Stormont request def. be allowed to enter residence.  State does not oppose.  Court finds state has complied iwth victim rights notification.  Court grants, section 3B of the bond is modified to allow def. permission to enter the premises.  State heard on their motion to seal the original criminal complaint dated 3/3/14 based on full name of minor witnesses listed.  Defense does not object.  Court grants, original criminal complaint dated 3/3/14 is to be sealed.  Court will proceed with the amended criminal complaint filed 3/4/14.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, SLL, dob 11/17/99 or her residence or any other members of her family.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at 341-1/2 N. Walnut Street, Mayville, WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.

Defendant Robert J. Sexton in custody via video with attorney Jessica Moeller (jail only).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 3/13/14 at 1:30pm in Br. 4 & RH 3/5/14 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets bond at $3,000.00 CASH bond  with conditions: #1 w/alleged victim, SLL, dob 11/17/99 or her residence or any other members of her family, #3 at 341-1/2 N.
